displayed_text: Patient: I got to talk to the heart doctor now because he has me on the aspirin and the… Family Member: Unless you think… Patient: The tush doctor told me no aspirin. Doctor: Don’t take it until – but that could probably be temporary as long as the bleeding has stopped you know if a few weeks they may be able to go ahead and restart. Family Member: So would we be completely transferring care downtown then? Doctor: For? Family Member: Every visit. Doctor: For some time yes. Family Member: And this would be like at first I know it’s super intensive with tests, but then does it go to once a month or is it always more intensive? Doctor: It does eventually. Yes. Yes after the first six to eight weeks. Family Member: But that’s a few months down the road. Patient: And you’d maintain the care?

Patient: Okay. Doctor: Sound good? Patient: Thank you again. Doctor: Tell them before the end of July because I’m taking off June and July I’m having hip surgery. Patient: Oh okay. Doctor: So I’ll be seeing you though towards the end of July. Okay? Patient: Okay. Doctor: Did you want to see him before we go? Healthcare Professional: Yes I do.

Family Member: But the lack of rest contributes to a lot of issues for both of us. Doctor: Um hum. Sure. Yeah. That will help with uh you feeling better during the day, too. Family Member: Yes. Doctor: Right. I see what you mean. Okay. So let me have S___ come in – Family Member: Okay. Doctor: -and give you a copy of the consent. Family Member: Okay. Doctor: But once we found out, she will be in touch. Family Member: Thank you. Doctor: To let you know what we’re going to do. Family Member: Okay. Patient: Okay.
